New Records: Harry Kane scored his 26th and 27th goals in 35 appearances at Wembley for his country; already the most of any England player at the venue.
Harry Kane became the first player to reach 100 games for England since Wayne Rooney in November 2014.
Lee Carsley is the first England manager to win his first two competitive games and keep a clean sheet in both since Steve McClaren in 2006.
Lille’s Angel Gomes became the first player to start for England while playing for a French club since Marseille’s Trevor Steven in June 1992.
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored twice to secure a 2-0 victory for England.
Kane's first goal came from a blistering second half strike.
Kane added a second goal after being fed the ball in the box by substitute Noni Madueke.
Kane had a goal disallowed for offside in the first half.
Hradecky made a crucial save from Kane's free kick.
Kane's shot was saved by Hradecky.
Pre-Game Insights: Harry Kane was awarded a gold cap to mark his 100th England appearance, presented by Frank Lampard.
Kane wore golden boots to commemorate his 100th cap.
Post-Match Reflections: Harry Kane expressed pride in reaching 100 caps and reflected on his journey from loan spells to becoming a key player for England.
Noni Madueke expressed pride in making his first appearance for the national team and assisting Kane on his 100th appearance.
Lee Carsley praised his team's performance and the clean sheet in his first two competitive games as manager.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England remain unbeaten against Finland, with this being their 10th victory across 12 meetings.
England have won their four home games against Finland by an aggregate score of 11-2.
